ai.summary: The Lundy Bay walk is a short, easy coastal stroll in North Cornwall. Covering about 2.3 km, it follows a gentle path with sea views, cliff-edge sections, and a relaxed pace suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat coastal path with occasional gentle inclines, uneven gravel or chalk surfaces, and some steps. Expect exposed cliff-side sections, sea spray, and rocky or sandy patches near coves.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times and weather before you go. Stay on marked paths and away from the edge of cliffs. Wear sturdy footwear and bring a layer for wind and rain. Carry water, sun protection, and a means to call for help; mobile signal may be limited in remote areas. Watch for slippery surfaces on wet days.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light boots
Windproof jacket or lightweight rain shell
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) for milder weather and better visibility; year-round can be enjoyable, but coastal conditions are variable and can be harsher in winter.
